info.title: REST API for Oracle Field Service Cloud Service February 2016
info.description:
Oracle Field Service Cloud Service extends your customer service operations into the field, allowing you to achieve operational excellence and improve productivity while surpassing customer expectations, no matter how complex your organization.

Oracle Field Service Cloud Service provides multiple public REST APIs that can be used to access data stored in Field Service Cloud and construct integrations to other systems. These systems could be other Oracle Cloud applications or offerings, or they could be external systems in a customer or partner network. Secure access to these services requires appropriate authentication for the environment, standard HTTP methods, and JSON syntax.
info.x-summary: Oracle Field Service Cloud Service extends your customer service operations into the field, allowing you to achieve operational excellence and improve productivity while surpassing customer expectations, no matter how complex your organization.

dailyExtractDate.title: Daily extract date
dailyExtractDate.description: Daily extract date of form: YYYY-MM-DD

dailyExtractDateFiles.title: Daily extract files
dailyExtractDateFiles.description: List of files available for a date

links.title: Links
links.description: This contains links for downloading the files

dailyExtractSubfolders.title: Daily extract subfolders
dailyExtractSubfolders.description: List of subfolders with daily extracts. Each subfolder has name of form 'YYYY-MM-DD'

links.title: Links
links.description: This contains links for accessing the subfolders

collaborationGroups.title: Collaboration groups
collaborationGroups.description: Collection of collaboration groups assigned to this user

blockedUntilTime.description: If set, then this account is blocked temporarily (e.g. too many failed login attempts). The value is the time when account becomes unblocked
blockedUntilTime.title: Blocked Until Time

timeZone.description: Time zone this user operates in
timeZone.title: Time Zone

password.description: Password of this user account. It is only used when login policy is set to "local password storage". For SAML etc it is ignored.
password.title: Password

lastUpdatedTime.description: Date of last update of this account
lastUpdatedTime.title: Last Updated Time

weekStart.description: When the week starts for this this user account
weekStart.title: Week Start

lastLoginTime.description: Date of last login of this account
lastLoginTime.title: Last Login Time

passwordTemporary.description: If set, then on next login, this user will be prompted to change password
passwordTemporary.title: Password Temporary

loginAttempts.description: Current number of unsuccessful login attempts
loginAttempts.title: Login Attempts

login.description: Login of this user account - it has to be unique per instance
login.title: Login

lastPasswordChangeTime.description: Date of last password change of this account
lastPasswordChangeTime.title: Last Password Change Time

longDateFormat.description: Date format of this user account
longDateFormat.title: Long Date Format

selfAssignment.description: Whether this user can assign activities to themselves
selfAssignment.title: Self Assignment

dateFormat.description: Date format of this user account
dateFormat.title: Date Format

createdTime.description: Date of creation of  this account
createdTime.title: Created Time

mainResourceId.description: Resource Id of the main resource of this user account. This field is only set for resources which represent field service personnel. It is not set for e.g. groups & routing buckets.
mainResourceId.title: Main Resource Id

language.description: UI language of this user account
language.title: Language

resources.description: List of resources assigned to this user account. These resources along with their children are visible to this user
resources.title: Resources

timeFormat.description: Time format of this user account
timeFormat.title: Time Format

userType.description: Type of user account, it defines access controls of the account
userType.title: User Type

timeZoneDiff.description: Read-only field indicating time zone difference according to specified time zone
timeZoneDiff.title: Time Zone Diff

date.description: Date this activity is scheduled scheduled. This field can be absent, meaning the activity is not scheduled for any particular date
date.title: Date

slaWindowStart.description: SLA start time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
slaWindowStart.title: Sla Window Start

startTime.description: Estimated time of arrival for pending activities, actual start time for started and /completed activities. In "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
startTime.title: Start Time

serviceWindowStart.description: customer service window start time in HH:MM:SS format
serviceWindowStart.title: Service Window Start

firstManualOperation.description: Name of first manual operation on this activity
firstManualOperation.title: First Manual Operation

teamResourceId.description: Id of the team resource if this activity is a team work
teamResourceId.title: Team Resource Id

workZone.description: An activity work zone. It is a read-only field that is assigned to activity automatically based on the company setting "work zone key" and the activity properties. E.g. if "work zone key" is "first 4 symbols of city field", then activity with city="Belfast" will have assigned a work zone, which has "BELF" set up as one of its keys.
workZone.title: Work Zone

travelTime.description: Estimated travel time to this activity. Estimate is based on previous activity in route
travelTime.title: Travel Time

deliveryWindowStart.description: activity delivery window start time in HH:MM:SS format
deliveryWindowStart.title: Delivery Window Start

endTime.description: Predicted or actual end time of activity in "YYYY-MMDD HH:MM:SS" format
endTime.title: End Time

slaWindowEnd.description: SLA end time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
slaWindowEnd.title: Sla Window End

city.description: customer's address. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
city.title: City

stateProvince.description: customer's state / province. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
stateProvince.title: State Province

streetAddress.description: customer's address. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
streetAddress.title: Street Address

points.description: Activity cost in "points". This field is intended for use by Routing module
points.title: Points

timeDeliveredStart.description: An arrival interval start time as communicated to the end customer
timeDeliveredStart.title: Time Delivered Start

resourceId.description: Id of the resource this activity is assigned to.
resourceId.title: Resource Id

reminderTime.description: Reminder notification time.  How many minutes before the activity start time the customer should be notified
reminderTime.title: Reminder Time

activityType.description: An activity type corresponds to a predefined company-specific set of rules applied when processing an activity. The rules cover the resources the activity can be assigned to, details of its processing and interaction with different modules of Oracle Field Service Cloud
activityType.title: Activity Type

apptNumber.description: This field is usually used by integrations to hold the external Id of activity - Id in the origin system.Has no business logic in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
apptNumber.title: Appt Number

masterActivityId.description: This field is not set for regular activities. It is present for activities which are segments of a multiday activity - which have recordType=multiday_activity_segment. This is the activityId of the multiday activity.
masterActivityId.title: Master Activity Id

deliveryWindowEnd.description: activity delivery window end time in HH:MM:SS format
deliveryWindowEnd.title: Delivery Window End

status.description: As the technician performs the activity, it changes its status. Based on this status different actions are available for an activity. Initial status is "pending" for newly activities, after that they can be "cancelled" or "started". Activities with status "started" can be made "complete", "notdone", or "suspended".
status.title: Status

positionInRoute.description: Position of activity in the route. Absent for not-ordered activities. 1-based number for ordered activities.
positionInRoute.title: Position In Route

postalCode.description: customer's postal code. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
postalCode.title: Postal Code

timeDeliveredEnd.description: An arrival interval end time as communicated to the end customer
timeDeliveredEnd.title: Time Delivered End

timeSlot.description: Activity Time Slot. It defines the service window
timeSlot.title: Time Slot

recordType.description: Type of activity record. Values are: "regular" - default value for most new activities."prework" - is created in Oracle Field Service Cloud if technician needs to perform pre-work before the actual activity."reopened" - is created when an activity in a final status is reopened for some reason."multiday_activity" - can be created using this API when "activityType" specified indicates that this is a multiday activity."multiday_activity_segment" - a number of these activities is automatically created for multiday activities, based on their duration and time slot settings.
recordType.title: Record Type

coordStatus.description: whether or not activity coordinates were found by geocoding
coordStatus.title: Coord Status

customerNumber.description: customer's account number. This field is usually used by integrations to hold the external Id of Account - Id in the origin system. Has no business logic in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
customerNumber.title: Customer Number

firstManualOperationUser.description: User who performed the first manual operation on this activity
firstManualOperationUser.title: First Manual Operation User

serviceWindowEnd.description: customer service window end time in HH:MM:SS format
serviceWindowEnd.title: Service Window End

activityId.description: Unique identifier of activity in Oracle Field Service Cloud
activityId.title: Activity Id

inventoryType.description: Type of the inventory as defined in OFSC. The inventory type marks inventory as serialized (identified by its serial number) or non-serialized (having no serial number).
inventoryType.title: Inventory Type

items.title: Event Name
items.description:
Event Name. Supported events are:
activityCreated,
activityUpdated,
activityStarted,
activitySuspended,
activityCompleted,
activityNotDone,
activityCanceled,
activityDeleted,
activityDelayed,
activityReopened,
activityPreworkCreated,
activityLinkCreated,
activityLinkDeleted,
resourcePreferenceCreated,
resourcePreferenceDeleted,
requiredInventoryCreated,
requiredInventoryUpdated,
requiredInventoryDeleted,
inventoryInstalled,
inventoryDeinstalled,
customerInventoryCreated,
customerInventoryUpdated,
customerInventoryDeleted,
inventoryUndoInstall,
inventoryUndoDeinstall,
activityMoved,
routeCreated,
routeUpdated,
routeActivated,
routeDeactivated,
routeReactivated,
customerRequestCreated,
inventoryRequestCreated,
resourceRequestCreated,
chatMessageSent

events.description:
List of events to subscribe to. Supported events are:
activityCreated,
activityUpdated,
activityStarted,
activitySuspended,
activityCompleted,
activityNotDone,
activityCanceled,
activityDeleted,
activityDelayed,
activityReopened,
activityPreworkCreated,
activityLinkCreated,
activityLinkDeleted,
resourcePreferenceCreated,
resourcePreferenceDeleted,
requiredInventoryCreated,
requiredInventoryUpdated,
requiredInventoryDeleted,
inventoryInstalled,
inventoryDeinstalled,
customerInventoryCreated,
customerInventoryUpdated,
customerInventoryDeleted,
inventoryUndoInstall,
inventoryUndoDeinstall,
activityMoved,
routeCreated,
routeUpdated,
routeActivated,
routeDeactivated,
routeReactivated,
customerRequestCreated,
inventoryRequestCreated,
resourceRequestCreated,
chatMessageSent

user.title: User

startedTime.description: Indicates the time when the chat was started (ISO-8601)

helpdeskName.title: Helpdesk Name

chat.title: Chat

subscriptionId.title: Subscription Id

events.title: Events

resourceId.description: Resource that has this inventory (or resource that is assigned an activity that has this inventory)
resourceId.title: Resource Id

activityId.description: Id of activity this inventory is assigned to. This field will be empty for inventories with status=resource
activityId.title: Activity Id

inventoryId.title: Inventory Id

date.description: Can be date "YYYY-MM-DD" or NULL. If this element is not NULL then activity will be re-scheduled to specified date. If it is NULL but parent setDate is present then activity will become "not scheduled"
date.title: date

setDate.description: If this element is present then activity will be re-scheduled to specified date
setDate.title: Set Date

activityId.title: activityId
activityId.description: If "position" is "afterActivity" then this is the activityId after which the other activity will be put

setPositionInRoute.description: If this element is present then activity will be put to specified position in route
setPositionInRoute.title: Set Position in Route

resourceId.title: resourceId
resourceId.description: If this element is present then activity will be reassigned to specified resource

setResource.description: If this element is present then activity will be reassigned to specified resource
setResource.title: Set Resource

minInterval.description: For links that define relative order of activities, this defines minumum acceptable time interval between subsequent activities (minutes)
minInterval.title: Min Interval

linkType.description: Type of relation between activities. These types are defined by the customer to suit their needs
linkType.title: Link Type

alerts.description: bitmask of alert flags (TODO: make this a set of string flags)
alerts.title: Alerts

maxInterval.description: For links that define relative order of activities, this defines maximym acceptable time interval between subsequent activities (minutes)
maxInterval.title: Max Interval

linkedActivity.description: The link represents a relation between two activities
linkedActivity.title: Activity Link

time.description: Time of operation. Optional. Default: current time
time.title: Time of operation

customActionActivityStatusChangeSchema.description: Custom Action Activity Status Change Schema

preferenceType.description: Preference type. "preferred" means resource will be preferred during routing, "required" - activity can only be assigned to one of "required" resources. "forbiddent" - activity cannot be assigned to this resource
preferenceType.title: Preference type

workZone.description: An activity work zone. It is a read-only field that is assigned to activity automatically based on the company setting "work zone key" and the activity properties. E.g. if "work zone key" is "first 4 symbols of city field", then activity with city="Belfast" will have assigned a work zone, which has "BELF" set up as one of its keys.
workZone.title: Work Zone

travelTime.description: Estimated travel time to this activity. Estimate is based on previous activity in route
travelTime.title: Travel Time

deliveryWindowStart.description: activity delivery window start time in HH:MM:SS format
deliveryWindowStart.title: Delivery Window Start

endTime.description: Predicted or actual end time of activity in "YYYY-MMDD HH:MM:SS" format
endTime.title: End Time

slaWindowEnd.description: SLA end time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
slaWindowEnd.title: Sla Window End

city.description: customer's address. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
city.title: City

stateProvince.description: customer's state / province. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
stateProvince.title: State Province

streetAddress.description: customer's address. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
streetAddress.title: Street Address

points.description: Activity cost in "points". This field is intended for use by Routing module
points.title: Points

timeDeliveredStart.description: An arrival interval start time as communicated to the end customer
timeDeliveredStart.title: Time Delivered Start

resourceId.description: Id of the resource this activity is assigned to.
resourceId.title: Resource Id

reminderTime.description: Reminder notification time.  How many minutes before the activity start time the customer should be notified
reminderTime.title: Reminder Time

activityType.description: An activity type corresponds to a predefined company-specific set of rules applied when processing an activity. The rules cover the resources the activity can be assigned to, details of its processing and interaction with different modules of Oracle Field Service Cloud
activityType.title: Activity Type

apptNumber.description: This field is usually used by integrations to hold the external Id of activity - Id in the origin system.Has no business logic in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
apptNumber.title: Appt Number

masterActivityId.description: This field is not set for regular activities. It is present for activities which are segments of a multiday activity - which have recordType=multiday_activity_segment. This is the activityId of the multiday activity.
masterActivityId.title: Master Activity Id

deliveryWindowEnd.description: activity delivery window end time in HH:MM:SS format
deliveryWindowEnd.title: Delivery Window End

status.description: As the technician performs the activity, it changes its status. Based on this status different actions are available for an activity. Initial status is "pending" for newly activities, after that they can be "cancelled" or "started". Activities with status "started" can be made "complete", "notdone", or "suspended".
status.title: Status

positionInRoute.description: Position of activity in the route. Absent for not-ordered activities. 1-based number for ordered activities.
positionInRoute.title: Position In Route

postalCode.description: customer's postal code. Note: this field is used by geocoding and, therefore, must contain a valid address. Other values will not be resolved correctly by the geocoding server.
postalCode.title: Postal Code

timeDeliveredEnd.description: An arrival interval end time as communicated to the end customer
timeDeliveredEnd.title: Time Delivered End

timeSlot.description: Activity Time Slot. It defines the service window
timeSlot.title: Time Slot

recordType.description: Type of activity record. Values are: "regular" - default value for most new activities."prework" - is created in Oracle Field Service Cloud if technician needs to perform pre-work before the actual activity."reopened" - is created when an activity in a final status is reopened for some reason."multiday_activity" - can be created using this API when "activityType" specified indicates that this is a multiday activity."multiday_activity_segment" - a number of these activities is automatically created for multiday activities, based on their duration and time slot settings.
recordType.title: Record Type

coordStatus.description: whether or not activity coordinates were found by geocoding
coordStatus.title: Coord Status

customerNumber.description: customer's account number. This field is usually used by integrations to hold the external Id of Account - Id in the origin system. Has no business logic in Oracle Field Service Cloud and can be left empty.
customerNumber.title: Customer Number

firstManualOperationUser.description: User who performed the first manual operation on this activity
firstManualOperationUser.title: First Manual Operation User

serviceWindowEnd.description: customer service window end time in HH:MM:SS format
serviceWindowEnd.title: Service Window End

activityId.description: Unique identifier of activity in Oracle Field Service Cloud
activityId.title: Activity Id

identifyActivityBy.title: identifyActivityBy
identifyActivityBy.description: This specifies the way activity should be identified

items.description: Name of activity property to not update
items.title: Property name

ifExistsThenDoNotUpdateFields.description: These fields will not be updated if activity already exists
ifExistsThenDoNotUpdateFields.title: If Exists Then Do Not Update Fields

ifInFinalStatusThen.title: If In Final Status Then
ifInFinalStatusThen.description: This specifies the action to be performed if activity already exists

updateParameters.description: These parameters determine what should be done if activity already exists in Field Service Cloud
updateParameters.title: Bulk update parameters

linkedActivities.description: Collection of activity to activity relations
linkedActivities.title: Linked activities

requiredInventory.description: Inventory item that is required to complete an activity

quantity.description: Quantity of inventory that is required to complete an activity
quantity.title: Required Inventory Quantity

inventoryType.description: Type of inventory that is required to complete an activity
inventoryType.title: Required Inventory Type

model.description: Model of inventory that is required to complete an activity
model.title: Required Inventory Model

requiredInventory.title: Required inventory

resourcePreferences.description: Collection of resource preferences for an activity
resourcePreferences.title: Resource preferences

requiredInventories.title: Required Inventories of activity
requiredInventories.description: Collection of inventory required to complete an activity

date.description: Date this activity is scheduled scheduled. This field can be absent, meaning the activity is not scheduled for any particular date
date.title: Date

slaWindowStart.description: SLA start time in "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
slaWindowStart.title: Sla Window Start

startTime.description: Estimated time of arrival for pending activities, actual start time for started and /completed activities. In "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS" format
startTime.title: Start Time

serviceWindowStart.description: customer service window start time in HH:MM:SS format
serviceWindowStart.title: Service Window Start

firstManualOperation.title: First Manual Operation

schedule.description: Contains a record for each date requested in schedulesToReturn request parameter

additionalProperties.description: Resource schedule info for the date

freeTimeWindows.description: Array of time (HH:MM) pairs that specify when the resource has free time this day. E.g: [["12:00","14:00"],["15:00","18:00"]]
freeTimeWindows.title: Free Time Windows

schedule.title: List of Resource Schedule Info. Keys are dates of form: YYYY-MM-DD

resourceInventories.title: Resource inventories
resourceInventories.description: Collection of inventories for a resource

resourceUsers.title: Resource users
resourceUsers.description: Collection of users assigned to this resource

plans.description: Collection of work plans for resource
plans.title: Work plans

resourceAssignedLocationsWeek.title: Resource assigned locations
resourceAssignedLocationsWeek.description: Assignments of resource locations for a week

workSchedulesCalendarView.title: Work schedules calendar view
workSchedulesCalendarView.description: Resource work schedule items to be presented in calendar control. Property name is date in 'YYYY-MM-DD' form.

limit.description: # of activities to be returned. set to 0 to only return route properties
limit.title: Limit

resource.description: Resource (which can represent e.g. a technican, a truck, a bucket). Not to confuse with REST resource.
resource.title: Resource

findMatchingResourcesRequestSchema.title: Find matching resources request

date.description: The date for which the API calculates fitness, where date matters. "YYYY-MM-DD" format.
date.title: Date

activityId.description: If specified, the API use properties of an existing activity to find matching resources. Either Activity ID or Activity Search Fields must be specified in the request
activityId.title: Activity ID

fields.description: Array of fields to be returned in response
fields.title: Fields

limit.description: Number of items to be returned
limit.title: Limit

schedulesToReturn.description: Array of dates for which the API is to return additional schedule info
schedulesToReturn.title: Schedules To Return

workSkill.description: Return only resources that have work skills required to do the activity
workSkill.title: Work Skill Filter Criteria

workTime.title: Work Time Filter Criteria
workTime.description: Return only resources that have at least specified amount of work time (in minutes) to do the activity

resourcePreference.description: Return only resources that meet specified resource preference level
resourcePreference.title: Resource Preference Filter Criteria

workZone.title: Work Zone Filter Criteria
workZone.description: Return only resources that work at the work zone activity belongs to

includeResources.title: Include Resources Filter Criteria
includeResources.description: Return only technician resources, only bucket resources or both

criteria.description: Criteria the API uses to filter results. Results with fitness value < specified cutoff point are removed from response. If particular criteria is absent, the API does not filter by this criteria. When criteria parameter is not set in request, the default is to apply all criteria
criteria.title: Criteria

activitySearchFields.description: If specified, the API looks for existing acitivity with matcing Appoitment Number, Customer Number or both. Then API returns resources to which this activity may be assigned
activitySearchFields.title: Activity Search Fields

findMatchingResourcesRequestSchema.description: Resources will be matched against criteria specified in this request

resourceUser.description: Collection of users assigned to this resource
resourceUser.title: Resource users

resourceAssignedLocationsDay.title: Resource assigned locations for a day

start.description: ID of the start location for this weekday
start.title: Start location ID

homeZoneCenter.description: ID of the home zone center location for this weekday
homeZoneCenter.title: Home zone center location ID

end.description: ID of the end location for this weekday
end.title: End location ID

resourceAssignedLocationsDay.description: Assignments of resource locations for a given weekday

measure.description: What kind of measure is used for this plan
measure.title: Measure

date.description: What kind of measure is used for this plan. Format: YYYY-MM-DD
date.title: Date

workSkills.description: Collection of resource work skill items
workSkills.title: Work zones

workTimeStart.description: Time when working day starts when this schedule is in effect (string "HH:MM"). Absent when isWorking=false
workTimeStart.title: Work time start

scheduleLabel.description: only present if recordType="schedule". One of the work schedules previously set up on OFSC UI.
scheduleLabel.title: Work schedule label

scheduleShifts.description: List of shifts present in this work schedule. Their properties are for information purpose only and cannot be modified using this API.
scheduleShifts.title: Shifts

startDate.description: Date this schedule comes into effect. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD"
startDate.title: Start date

shiftLabel.description: only present if recordType in ("shift", "extra_shift"). One of the work shifts previously set up on OFSC UI.
shiftLabel.title: Work shift label

points.description: Points - "units of labor per day" for days when this schedule is in effect. May be empty as not all customers use it.
points.title: Points

isWorking.description: If true then this shift is working day, otherwise non-working (e.g. holiday, vacation). read-only field calculated based on recordType or shift settings.
isWorking.title: Is working shift

endDate.description: Date this schedule ends. Format is "YYYY-MM-DD"
endDate.title: End date

nonWorkingReason.description: Label of reason why this day is non-working (e.g. holiday, vacation). These reasons are preconfigured in OFSC UI. Absent when isWorking=true.
nonWorkingReason.title: Non-working reason

workTimeEnd.description: Time when working day ends when this schedule is in effect (string "HH:MM"). Absent when isWorking=false.
workTimeEnd.title: Work time end

dayFrom.description: Only present if recurEvery="year". Start day every year when this schedule is in effect (string "MM-DD")
dayFrom.title: Day from

items.title: Weekday
items.description: Only present if recurEvery='week'. array of strings in set ['Sun', 'Mon', 'Tue', 'Wed', 'Thu', 'Fri', 'Sat']

dayTo.description: Only present if recurEvery="year". End day every year when this schedule is in effect (string "MM-DD")
dayTo.title: Day from

scheduleItemId.description: OFSC-internal identifier of this item. It is used to delete it.
scheduleItemId.title: Work schedule item ID

tags.description: Operations that let client subscribe to Field Service Cloud Service events, and get notifications these events occur
